paper_title.ja: ポンティック基底面の接触圧に関する研究 第1報 ポリフッ化ビニリデンフィルムの応用
paper_title.en: The Study on the Pressure Put by Contacting Basal surface of Pontic : part1 : Application of Polyvinylidene Fluoride Film

description.ja: ブリッジのポンティック基底面が歯槽堤粘膜に及ぼす影響は,生物学的観点から重視されている.しかし粘膜接触型ポンティックを使用する場合の接触状態については,成書では無圧で,あるいはわずかに粘膜を圧迫する程度でといった表現がなされており,客観的に接触状態を判定する基準はない.そこで圧力センサーの一種であるポリフッ化ビニリデンフィルム(PVDF)を,ポンティックの粘膜に対する接触圧測定に応用することを考えた.今回は基礎的な実験として疑似粘膜上にこのPVDFを置き,加圧子で荷重を加えた場合に現れた出力電圧波形を分析して,荷重と相関関係を表すパラメーターを検索した.
description.en: In order to develop a measurement system for the additional load by contacting the basal surface of the pontic, polyvinylidene fluoride film (PVDF) was used to investigate its usefulness. The following four parameters correlated with additional loads : (1) maximum of positive output voltage, (2) maximum of negative output voltage, (3) first area surrounded with non-output line and output voltage line, and (4) entire area surrounded by non-output line and output voltage line. Additional loads were computed by these parameters. The result indicates that PVDF is useful for measuring the load added by contacting the basal surface of the pontic.

publisher.ja: 社団法人日本補綴歯科学会

publication_name.ja: 日本補綴歯科学会雑誌
publication_name.en: The journal of the Japan Prosthodontic Society

description.en: In order to develop a measurement system for the additional load by contacting the basal surface of the pontic, polyvinylidene fluoride film (PVDF) was used to investigate its usefulness. The following four parameters correlated with additional loads : (1) maximum of positive output voltage, (2) maximum of negative output voltage, (3) first area surrounded with non-output line and output voltage line, and (4) entire area surrounded by non-output line and output voltage line. Additional loads were computed by these parameters. The result indicates that PVDF is useful for measuring the load added by contacting the basal surface of the pontic.

顎顔面欠損患者の一治療例 軟質材料による中空型栓塞部および発泡ポリウレタンエピテーゼの応用
paper_title.en: A Case of the Maxillofacial Defect Patient : Clinical Application of Foaming Polyurethane Elastomer for Facial Prosthesis and Hollow Obturator Using Soft Material

description.ja: 悪性腫瘍などにより顎顔面補綴が必要となった患者に対しては,咀咽や発音といった機能や審美性を改善してやることはもちろんであるが,患者の社会復帰を促す上から,心理面での回復をはかることも重要である.今回われわれは,上顎左側に発生した偏平上皮癌を外科的に切除した結果,顎顔面部に眼球を含む広範な欠損を有するに至った患者を診る機会を得た.この症例に対して,顎義歯栓塞部にレジン系光重合型軟質裏装材を応用し中空型とした上顎全部床顎義歯と,発泡ポリウレタン製のエピテーゼを製作することにより顎顔面補綴処置を施した結果,良好な予後を得ているので報告する.
description.en: t is ttecessary for the edentulous maxillofacial patient to improve not cnly the physical functionand appearance but also psychological recovery. A case of maxillcfacial prosthesis using new material forobturatccr is reported. 'I'he patietat is 70-year-old man who received surgical resection of the left maxilla,imvcluding orbita and upper half of the ramus of the mandible, to remove a squamous cell carcinoma. In thepost-operation course, he visited otur cliutic to restore mastication, articulatiott and esthetics. A maxillaryprosthesis with a holloxv type obtttratccr usittg light-cured resin type soft linirtg material was fabricated. Torecover the left facial defect, the epithesis using foaming pclyurethane was fabricated. 15 mottths have passedsince completion of treatunent, however, there was 110 tissue erccsiout or bleeding in the supporting area of themaxillary sinus. Physical fuuaction was ccnsiderably improved and the patient was pleased with his esthetics.

description.en: t is ttecessary for the edentulous maxillofacial patient to improve not cnly the physical functionand appearance but also psychological recovery. A case of maxillcfacial prosthesis using new material forobturatccr is reported. 'I'he patietat is 70-year-old man who received surgical resection of the left maxilla,imvcluding orbita and upper half of the ramus of the mandible, to remove a squamous cell carcinoma. In thepost-operation course, he visited otur cliutic to restore mastication, articulatiott and esthetics. A maxillaryprosthesis with a holloxv type obtttratccr usittg light-cured resin type soft linirtg material was fabricated. Torecover the left facial defect, the epithesis using foaming pclyurethane was fabricated. 15 mottths have passedsince completion of treatunent, however, there was 110 tissue erccsiout or bleeding in the supporting area of themaxillary sinus. Physical fuuaction was ccnsiderably improved and the patient was pleased with his esthetics.
